items.title: DSTLRY Launches New Customization Features for Artists in Digital Comics Marketplace
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- DSTLRY has introduced two new features: Commissioned Digital Remarques and Unlimited Digital Covers.
- Commissioned Digital Remarques allow creators to add personalized sketches and signatures to digital comics, replicating traditional comic customization.
- Unlimited Digital Covers maintains the availability of both main and alternative covers in digital circulation for the book's lifecycle, enhancing collectability while still offering some scarcity.

items.title: How Max Altschuler accidentally founded a VC firm that just raised another $54M
items.summary:
- GTMfund founder Max Altschuler raised a second fund of $54 million after originally aiming for $50 million.
- The fund is backed by operators from successful tech companies like AWS and OpenAI, focusing on mentoring portfolio companies in sales strategies.
- Fund II attracted 300 operator LPs and six institutional investors, building on the success of the first fund launched in 2021, which included 250 operators and backed notable companies such as AI composer Writer and data center tech Atlan.
- GTMfund aims to invest in about 40 early-stage companies, with check sizes ranging from $500,000 to $1.5 million.

items.title: Apple launches Invites, a new app for creating custom invitations
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Apple launched a new app called “Invites” for creating custom invitations for occasions.
- Users require an iCloud+ subscription to create invitations, but anyone can RSVP.
- Invites competes with third-party apps like Partiful and services such as evite and Paperless Post.
- The app features event integration with Maps and Weather, allowing guests to get directions and weather updates.
- Users can create event soundtracks with Apple Music and collaborate on a Shared Album for photos and videos.
- Hosts can manage events, share invite links, and adjust visible invitation details.
- Apple Invites is free for iPhone models running iOS 18 or later and accessible on the web via icloud.com/invites.

items.title: Former Tesla engineer heading government agency reportedly outlines ‘AI-first strategy’
items.author: Thomas Shedd
items.summary:
- Thomas Shedd, a former Tesla engineer, is now the director of Technology Transformation Services.
- Shedd outlined an "AI-first strategy" for the U.S. government to run the office like a "startup software company."
- The initiative is part of a cost-cutting measure, with the department facing a potential 50% budget cut.
- Shedd aims to create a centralized government contract database designed for AI analysis.

items.title: Deepfake videos are getting shockingly good
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Researchers from ByteDance demonstrated a new AI system, [OmniHuman-1](https://omnihuman-lab.github.io/), which generates highly realistic deepfake videos.
- Unlike previous deepfakes, OmniHuman-1 can produce convincing videos using just one reference image and audio.
- The system shows significant improvements but still struggles with low-quality images and certain poses.
- Deepfakes have been part of spreading misinformation and financial fraud, causing substantial losses in recent years.
- An open letter from the AI community calls for strict regulations on deepfakes; some states are enacting laws against AI impersonation.
- Public concern is rising as a survey indicates 60% of people encountered deepfakes in the past year, with many fearing they could be misled.

items.title: LogicStar is building AI agents for app maintenance
items.summary:
- Swiss startup [LogicStar](https://logicstar.ai/) focuses on developing AI agents for autonomous app maintenance, securing $3 million in pre-seed funding.
- CEO Boris Paskalev emphasizes the goal to resolve software bugs more effectively than current AI models by utilizing a test-driven development approach.
- The startup's technology currently supports Python, with plans to expand to Typescript, Javascript, and Java, targeting enterprises for implementation.

items.title: Two space startups have merged to create the next generation of telescopes
items.summary:
- OurSky and PlaneWave Instruments are merging to form a new company called Observable Space.
- The merger aims to create more user-friendly telescopes and integrate various components for ease of use.
- Observable Space has already raised $11 million and counts NASA and the U.S. Space Force among its customers.

items.title: Spotify reports its first full year of profitability, adds 35M monthly active users
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Spotify announced its fourth-quarter earnings, achieving its first full year of profitability after 17 years.
- Operating income for Q4 reached €477 million ($509.48 million), totaling €1.4 billion ($1.495 billion) for fiscal year 2024.
- The company added 35 million monthly active users, bringing the total to 675 million, a 12% year-over-year increase, exceeding projections of 25 million.
- Total paid subscribers rose to 263 million, up from 240 million despite recent price hikes on Premium subscriptions.
- Plans for a HiFi or “super premium” subscription tier were teased, potentially increasing monthly costs by around $5.
- Spotify signed a new multi-year distribution agreement with Universal Music Group, aimed at protecting streaming royalties and enabling new offerings for fans.

items.title: OpenAI’s Operator agent helped me move, but I had to help it, too
items.summary:
- OpenAI's new AI agent, Operator, was tested over one week for task automation on the internet.
- Operator can perform basic tasks such as navigating websites and filling out forms but requires significant user assistance.
- The agent operates like cruise control rather than full autopilot, needing frequent user input and intervention.
- While some companies (like Instacart and eBay) support Operator, others (like TaskRabbit and YouTube) block its access.
- Trust issues arise due to instances of hallucination that could lead to costly mistakes, making users hesitant to rely solely on the AI agent.

items.title: Sotira lands $2M to help brands offload and monetize their surplus inventory
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Sotira aims to tackle the surplus inventory issue, which is estimated to be 20%-30% of all inventory in the U.S.
- The startup has raised $2 million in pre-seed funding to expand operations nationwide, focusing on the Midwest and Southeast.
- Sotira uses AI to help brands offload surplus grocery, health, and cosmetics products quickly and efficiently.
- The founders, Amrita Bhasin and Gary Kwong, have a background in e-commerce and logistics, having previously run liquidation businesses.
- Suppliers can match their overstock with buyers through Sotira, which automates compliance and logistics to facilitate fast transactions.
- Sotira charges a monthly fee and takes a percentage of the revenue from each transaction on its platform.
- The company offers affordable access to premium products for consumers, especially in rural areas.
- Sotira plans to expand its services to the apparel industry in the future.

items.title: Team behind Twitterrific launches a multi-feed app called Tapestry
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- After Elon Musk's takeover, Twitter blocked third-party clients in 2023.
- Iconfactory launches the multi-feed app Tapestry, supporting sources like RSS, YouTube, and more.
- Tapestry raised over $177,000 on Kickstarter in January 2025 and emphasizes user data privacy.
- Users can customize feeds and create rules to mute specific content.
- The app offers subscription features for creating multiple feeds and removing ads at various price points.

items.title: Snap unveils AI text-to-image model for mobile devices
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Snap has revealed a new AI text-to-image model designed for mobile devices, particularly the iPhone 16 Pro Max, producing images in about 1.4 seconds.
- The model operates entirely on the device, cutting down computational costs compared to server-reliant models.
- Features powered by this model will include AI Snaps and AI Bitmoji Backgrounds, set to launch in the coming months.
- Snap aims to provide high-quality AI tools at lower operational costs with this in-house technology, continuing its investment in AI and ML.
- Previous tools incorporated AI from OpenAI and Google, but now Snap introduces its unique offering amidst a competitive tech landscape.

items.title: LinkedIn amps up vertical video tools as uploads jump 36%
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- LinkedIn reported a 36% increase in video uploads compared to last year, with video creation on the platform rising 100%.
- New features include a vertical video display for all users and tools to enhance viewer engagement.
- The update follows LinkedIn's revenue growth of 9% and the presence of over 1 billion users.
- Video viewership on the platform has also increased by 36% in the past year.
- A new profile preview feature and a video carousel in search results are being added to enhance user experience.

items.title: Walkstar is a new iOS app that pauses songs when you stop moving
items.author: Greg Gardner, Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Walkstar launched on February 4, 2025, in the App Store.
- The app plays music only while the user is moving and pauses when they stop.
- Created by Greg Gardner, it features a retro interface resembling a cassette player.
- Offers Game Center integration, Live Activity widget, and Shortcuts for convenience.
- Available for free with a premium subscription for custom features and analytics.
- Currently compatible with Apple services; exploring integration with Spotify.

items.title: Canada’s StackAdapt snaps up $235M for its AI-based programmatic platform
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- StackAdapt, a Toronto-based programmatic advertising startup, raised $235 million in equity funding.
- The funding round was led by Teachers’ Venture Growth (TVG), the investment arm of the Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan.
- StackAdapt aims to position itself as a leader in AI-driven advertising, competing in a rapidly evolving market.

items.title: Archive raises $30M to solve fashion’s pollution problem with online resales
items.author: Dominic-Madori Davis
items.summary:
[Archive, founded by Emily Gittins and Ryan Rowe, aims to provide resale platforms for fashion brands to reduce pollution.]
[The company has raised $30 million in Series B funding led by Energize Capital, totaling $54 million to date.]
[The second-hand market is projected to reach $73 billion by 2028 in the U.S., spurring interest from investors and legislation supporting sustainable practices.]

items.title: Egypt’s Khazna banks $16M for its financial super app and expansion into Saudi
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Khazna, a fintech startup in Egypt, raised $16 million in pre-Series B funding, totaling over $63 million.
- The funding will aid in its expansion into Saudi Arabia and it will apply for a digital banking license in Egypt by mid-2026.
- The company focuses on financial services for low- and middle-income workers, offering solutions like salary advances and microloans, currently serving over 500,000 users.
- Khazna aims to differentiate itself from competitors with medium-term credit products such as earned wage access and payroll-backed lending.
- The startup plans to capitalize on the Egypt-Saudi remittance corridor, where nearly three million Egyptians reside, and targets 40-50% of its business from Saudi Arabia in four years.
- Khazna's growth is also supported by renewed investor confidence due to significant foreign direct investment flowing into Egypt following economic reforms.

items.title: Grubhub confirms data breach affecting customers and drivers
items.author: Carly Page
items.summary:
- Grubhub reported a data breach where hackers accessed personal details of customers and drivers.
- The breach was linked to unauthorized access from a third-party service provider.
- Affected personal details include names, email addresses, phone numbers, and partial payment card information; bank account details and Social Security numbers were not compromised.
- Grubhub has not disclosed the number of affected individuals or when the incident occurred.

items.title: OpenAI Expands in Asia with Kakao Partnership Following SoftBank Deal
items.author: Kate Park, Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- OpenAI announces a partnership with Kakao to expand its presence in Asia, focusing on Korean language content.
- The collaboration will result in the creation of a Korean-language assistant named Kanana and integration of OpenAI technology into KakaoTalk.
- This announcement follows SoftBank's commitment of $3 billion to implement OpenAI technology across its operations and the establishment of a joint venture called SB OpenAI Japan.
- OpenAI aims to enhance its AI capabilities by gaining access to more Asian-language data and user behavior.
- OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman highlighted Korea's advanced AI adoption and its significance for future growth in the region.
- The partnerships also come in response to competition from Chinese AI firm DeepSeek, prompting OpenAI to strengthen its international reach.

items.title: Waabi and Volvo team up to build self-driving trucks at scale
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary:
- Waabi partners with Volvo to develop autonomous trucks for commercial launch.
- The collaboration marks Volvo's second partnership for self-driving technology, following its deal with Aurora Innovation in May 2024.
- Waabi aims to run commercial pilot programs in Texas and expects a driverless demonstration in late 2025.
- Waabi has raised $282 million, with a plan for capital-efficient AI technology to reduce costs in the driverless launch.

items.title: SoftBank-backed billionaire to invest $230M in Indian AI startup Krutrim
items.author: Manish Singh
items.summary:
- Ola founder Bhavish Aggarwal is investing $230 million into Krutrim, an AI startup he founded.
- The investment is part of a goal to raise $1.15 billion by next year, with Krutrim aiming to build India’s largest supercomputer.
- Krutrim has released a 12-billion parameter language model, Krutrim-2, showing high performance in processing Indian languages, with noted successes in sentiment analysis and code generation.
- The startup has also opened sourced several models optimized for Indian languages, hoping to foster collaboration within the Indian AI community.

items.title: Opera launches a mindfulness-focused browser with break reminders and soundscapes
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- Norway-based browser maker [Opera](https://www.opera.com/) launched a new browser called "Opera Air" focused on mental well-being and mindfulness.
- Features include break reminders, breathing exercises, soundscapes, and binaural beats for better focus.
- The browser has a lightweight design with a floating sidebar providing various mindfulness tools, including a break reminder that acts like a battery indicator.
- Users can define continuous usage time, after which the system prompts them to take a break, with options for breathing exercises and neck stretches.
- Boosts feature combines music and ambient sounds to enhance focus, allowing users to customize tracks and session lengths.
- Currently, the guided exercises are only available in English, but plans for other languages are in development.
- Opera created a separate browser for mindfulness instead of integrating these features into existing browsers like Opera One, emphasizing a minimalistic design.

items.title: AI agents for e-commerce startup, founded by Google and DeepMind alums, raises $10M seed
items.author: Morteza Ibrahimi, Ahmad Khwlieh, Dina Alsamhan
items.summary:
- Dubai-based Qeen.ai raises $10 million to enhance its platform that provides autonomous AI agents for e-commerce.
- Led by Prosus Ventures, this seed round is one of the largest in the Middle East's AI industry.
- The founders, with backgrounds from Google and DeepMind, aim to improve e-commerce processes through AI, targeting small and mid-sized merchants in MENA.
- Qeen.ai's agents handle content creation, marketing, and sales, allowing businesses to compete without expensive agencies.
- The platform utilizes proprietary RL-UI technology to optimize marketing strategies in real-time.
- Since launching its Dynamic Content agent, Qeen.ai has served over 15 million users and helped merchants increase sales by 30%.
- The startup follows a subscription-based pricing model, generating revenue from content automation and AI marketing agents.
- Qeen.ai emphasizes its advantage over competitors by focusing on the underserved Middle Eastern market and leveraging strong local and international talent.

items.title: Neuralk-AI is developing AI models specifically designed for structured data
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- Neuralk-AI focuses on AI models for tabular data, which includes structured data like SQL databases and spreadsheets.
- The startup raised $4 million in funding led by Fly Ventures, with participation from SteamAI and several angel investors.
- Plans to offer its models as an API to data scientists, aiming to assist commerce companies in data automation and fraud detection.
- A public benchmark will be released in about three to four months to rank their model against others in the sector.
- Collaborating with French retailers like E.Leclerc and Auchan for testing its models.

items.title: China hits back at Trump tariffs with Google antitrust investigation
items.author: Manish Singh
items.summary:
- China launches an antitrust investigation into Google following a 10% tariff imposed by President Trump on Chinese goods.
- The State Administration for Market Regulation will check for monopolistic practices by Google, which has been blocked in China since 2010 but still operates there in advertising.
- In retaliation, China also places tariffs on U.S. coal, LNG, oil, and agricultural equipment, and adds companies like PVH Corp. and Illumina to a restricted list.
- Trump's tariffs aim to address Beijing's failure to curb illegal drug flows, escalating trade tensions between the U.S. and China.

items.title: Accel backs Indian AI startup building ‘ChatGPT for presentations’
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Presentations.ai, an Indian AI startup, raised $3 million in seed funding led by Accel.
- The startup aims to help companies generate presentation decks quickly, having gained over 5 million users since its public beta launch in 2023.
- CEO Sumanth Raghavendra envisions it as the ‘ChatGPT for presentations’.
- The company transitioned to a freemium model in early 2024 and has tens of thousands of paying users.
- Features include AI-powered design assistance, multilingual support, and enterprise-grade security measures.

items.title: Adam Candeub, a vocal critic of Big Tech, will reportedly join the FCC
items.author: Becca Szkutak
items.summary:
- Adam Candeub poised to join the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) as general counsel.
- Reports confirm his position from FCC chairman Brendan Carr.
- Candeub is a known critic of Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act.
- Previously served as an advisor to the FCC and in roles within the Trump Administration.
- Current law professor at Michigan State University since 2004.

items.title: Ontario cancels, then restores, $68 million Starlink contract after protesting US tariffs
items.author: Dominic-Madori Davis
items.summary:
- Ontario Premier Doug Ford announced the cancellation of a $68 million contract with Starlink due to a 25% tariff on Canadian imports announced by President Trump.
- Ford later reinstated the contract after Trump delayed the tariff implementation for 30 days following Canadian concessions.
- The contract, signed in November 2024, aims to provide internet services to remote areas of Ontario, amidst heightened tensions over U.S. tariffs affecting Canadian goods.

items.title: Stripe brings aboard new head of ‘startup and VC partnerships’
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Asya Bradley has joined Stripe as the head of Startup & Venture Capital Partnerships, announced on February 2, 2025.
- She previously served as the chief revenue officer of Synapse and held roles at Sila and igniteXL Ventures, and co-founded Kinly, sold to Greenwood in 2023.
- Bradley is also a limited partner in venture funds and is part of the Cap Table Coalition, promoting diversity in investment.

items.title: Naver-backed Cinamon wants to make 3D video animation easier using AI
items.author: Kate Park
items.summary:
- South Korean startup Cinamon raised $8.5 million Series B to enhance its animated video generation platform CINEV, launching in beta in H1 2025.
- CINEV enables users to create 3D environments and edit scenes via text prompts and sliders, combining AI motion generation with a 3D asset library.
- The startup aims to serve a range of users including artists, game developers, and animators, facilitating easier video production workflows.

items.title: No, DeepSeek isn’t uncensored if you run it locally
items.summary:
- DeepSeek's supposedly local censorship can mislead users into thinking it's eliminated when running locally.
- Investigations reveal that censorship is present at both application and training levels of DeepSeek.
- Examples show that DeepSeek avoids mentioning certain historical events, like the Cultural Revolution, and censorship persists even in locally run versions.

items.title: Meta says it may stop development of AI systems it deems too risky
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
• Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg aims to make artificial general intelligence (AGI) open in the future.
• Meta's new Frontier AI Framework categorizes AI systems as "high-risk" or "critical-risk" based on their potential for harm.
• High-risk systems may assist in attacks but are less reliable, while critical-risk systems could result in catastrophic outcomes.
• Meta's classification relies on input from researchers rather than empirical tests, due to lack of robust evaluation metrics.
• If a system is deemed high-risk, internal access will be limited; critical-risk systems will halt development until mitigations are in place.
• Meta's approach contrasts with companies like OpenAI, as it has previously released AI models openly, leading to both successes and security concerns.

items.title: DeepSeek: The countries and agencies that have banned the AI company’s tech
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- DeepSeek, a Chinese AI company, faces bans from various countries and organizations due to ethics, privacy, and security concerns.
- Italy initiated a ban after an investigation into DeepSeek's data handling, particularly related to GDPR compliance.
- Taiwan's Ministry of Digital Affairs banned DeepSeek due to national security risks, applying restrictions to government and educational institutions.
- The U.S. Congress warned its offices against using DeepSeek tech, citing risks of malicious software.
- Texas Governor Greg Abbott banned DeepSeek software from state-issued devices, asserting protection against foreign data harvesting.
- The U.S. Navy prohibited its members from using DeepSeek apps due to security and ethical concerns.
- The Pentagon blocked access to DeepSeek after unauthorized usage was identified among its staff members.
- NASA also implemented a ban on DeepSeek technologies, citing national security issues tied to data management.

items.title: Journalist targeted on WhatsApp by Paragon spyware: ‘I feel violated’
items.author: Francesco Cancellato
items.summary:
- Journalist Francesco Cancellato received a WhatsApp notification indicating a spyware attack on his device by Paragon Solutions.
- Approximately 90 individuals, including journalists and members of civil society, were targeted globally in this hacking campaign.
- Cancellato expressed feelings of violation and raised concerns about the implications of the spyware on his personal and professional information.
- His publication, Fanpage.it, is known for investigative journalism regarding corruption and political issues in Italy.
- WhatsApp stated they disrupted the campaign by Paragon Solutions, an Israeli spyware company.
- Cancellato decided to come forward publicly to report the incident as part of his journalistic duty, while remaining uncertain about the attackers' motives.

items.title: Trump says new US sovereign wealth fund could purchase TikTok
items.summary:
- President Trump signed an executive order to create a U.S. sovereign wealth fund that may purchase TikTok.
- The fund is to be established within the next 12 months by the U.S. Treasury and Commerce Departments.
- Trump's previous executive order delayed the TikTok ban deadline by 75 days.
- Multiple parties, including Microsoft, Elon Musk, and Larry Ellison, have shown interest in purchasing TikTok.
- A decision regarding TikTok's future in the U.S. is expected in February.

items.title: Ontario cancels $68 million Starlink contract in protest at US tariffs
items.author: Dominic-Madori Davis
items.summary:
- Ontario's Premier Doug Ford announced the cancellation of a $68 million contract with Elon Musk's Starlink satellite service.
- The decision comes after President Trump announced a 25% tariff on Canadian imports, prompting Canada to retaliate with a similar tariff on U.S. goods.
- Ford stated that Ontario will not engage with businesses that harm the economy, labeling Musk as part of the Trump administration's negative impact on Canadian families and businesses.

items.title: Ontario cancels $100 million Starlink contract in protest at U.S. tariffs
items.author: Dominic-Madori Davis
items.summary:
- Ontario Premier Doug Ford announced the cancellation of a $100 million contract with Starlink due to U.S. tariffs.
- The cancellation follows President Trump's announcement of a 25% tariff on Canadian imports, prompting retaliatory measures from Canada.
- Ford stated that U.S. companies will be banned from future provincial contracts until the tariffs are lifted, criticizing Musk's ties to the Trump administration.

items.title: Hot Tub, the first native iPhone porn app, arrives in EU
TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: Secure your ticket at this year’s lowest rates
items.summary:
- Super Early Bird prices available for TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 until the end of February.
- Save up to $1,130 on individual tickets and up to 30% on group passes.
- Event scheduled for October 27-29, 2025, at Moscone West in San Francisco.
- Features over 10,000 attendees, 250+ sessions, and the Startup Battlefield 200 competition.
- Key topics include AI applications across various industries and sessions with industry leaders.

items.title: The Beatles won a Grammy last night, thanks to AI
items.summary:
- The Beatles’ AI-assisted track “Now and Then” won the Grammy for Best Rock Performance.
- This is the first time a song using AI technology has won this award.
- Paul McCartney used noise reduction systems to enhance a low-quality demo from John Lennon, which has been updated using new audio isolation techniques.

items.title: OpenAI’s new trademark application hints at humanoid robots, smart jewelry, and more
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- OpenAI filed a trademark application for new product lines including humanoid robots, smart jewelry, and AI-assisted hardware on February 3, 2025.
- The application suggests developments in consumer electronics such as headphones, smartwatches, and virtual reality headsets.
- CEO Sam Altman indicated partnerships for developing AI-powered consumer hardware.
- OpenAI is forming a robotics team to explore humanoid robots with communication and learning functions.
- The filing also mentions custom AI chips and potential quantum computing advancements for improving AI model performance.
- The future of these technologies in market remains uncertain, as trademarks are usually broad and exploratory.

items.title: What PowerSchool won’t say about its data breach affecting millions of students
items.summary:
- PowerSchool confirmed a significant data breach affecting its K-12 software, impacting 60 million students across North America.
- Hackers gained access through compromised credentials, targeting the PowerSource customer support portal.
- Initial awareness of the breach came on December 28, 2024, with notification of affected individuals starting on January 29, 2025.
- Reports suggest that over 62 million students’ personal data may have been accessed, but PowerSchool has not confirmed this figure.
- The exact number of affected schools and the specific data accessed remain unclear.
- Sensitive data, including grades and potentially Social Security numbers, may have been stolen, but the scope of the data is still unknown.
- PowerSchool has not disclosed whether a ransom was paid or what evidence it has regarding the deletion of the stolen data.
- The identity of the hackers and the results of an investigation by CrowdStrike are yet to be revealed.

items.title: Hero’s all-in-one, AI productivity app takes on Google’s Calendar and others
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- Hero is an all-in-one productivity app with an AI assistant, developed by former Meta employees Brad Kowalk and Seung W. Lee.
- The app aims to combine notes, scheduling, and to-dos into a single platform, reducing the need for multiple apps.
- Hero has raised $4 million in seed funding from notable investors including the founders of Instacart and Dropbox.
- Features include a daily schedule, weather updates, to-do lists, grocery lists, and the ability to add friends for easy sharing and collaboration.
- The AI assistant can create notes, generate lists, and help with task management.
- The app is free, currently monetizing through grocery orders via Instacart.

items.title: What is Bluesky? Everything to know about the X competitor
items.summary:
- Bluesky, the decentralized social app, has surpassed 30 million users as of February 2025.
- Growth attributed to policy changes at X (formerly Twitter) and user migration following the 2024 U.S. presidential election.
- Bluesky was conceptualized by Jack Dorsey and uses a decentralized protocol, allowing for enhanced user control and transparency.
- Notable users include Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Mark Cuban, and numerous news organizations.
- Bluesky plans to maintain a free platform without relying on user data for ad revenue, exploring subscription options for premium features.

items.title: Riot raises $30 million for its cybersecurity product suite focused on employees
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- French startup [Riot](https://tryriot.com/) raised $30 million in Series B funding after achieving $10 million in annual revenue in 2024.
- Led by Left Lane Capital, with participation from Y Combinator, Base10, and FundersClub, Riot's post-money valuation is over $170 million.
- Riot plans to expand its focus from educating employees on phishing to managing employee security posture with a new platform, aiming to prevent cyber incidents that are on the rise.

items.title: Samsung chief Jay Y. Lee cleared of all charges in 2015 merger case
items.author: Kate Park
items.summary:
- A Seoul appeals court upheld the acquittal of Jay Y. Lee, Samsung's Executive Chairman, in a 2015 merger case.
- Lee faced 19 charges related to accounting fraud and stock manipulation but was found not guilty.
- The court dismissed the prosecution's appeal, stating that the merger followed standard operational procedures between Samsung affiliates.

items.title: Tana snaps up $25M, with its AI-powered knowledge graph for work racking up a 160k+ waitlist
items.summary:
- Tana has emerged from stealth with $25 million in funding.
- It features AI-powered tools for automated task management, note-taking, and action item generation.
- Tana has already built a waitlist of over 160,000 users and tested by 30,000 in a closed beta.
- The platform is designed for individuals and teams to improve efficiency through a 'knowledge graph.'
- The application can listen to conversations and transcribe them into actionable data.
- Founded by ex-Googlers, Tana's development focuses on leveraging AI models, partnering primarily with OpenAI.

items.title: DeepSeek founder Liang Wenfeng receives a hero’s welcome back home
items.summary:
- DeepSeek founder Liang Wenfeng returns to Guangdong, China, for the Lunar New Year, celebrated with a hero's welcome.
- Wenfeng is a billionaire hedge fund manager known for his research showing AI models can be built with fewer Nvidia chips, crucial for China.
- Locals describe him as a top student from an educational family, and there's a sense of pride in his achievements, despite his desire to avoid public attention.

items.title: India expands Aadhaar authentication for businesses, raising privacy concerns
items.author: Jagmeet Singh
items.summary:
- India has eased restrictions on its Aadhaar authentication service for businesses across various sectors.  
- The Indian IT ministry introduced new rules allowing wider use of Aadhaar for service delivery as of February 2, 2025.  
- These changes have raised privacy concerns, especially regarding the safeguarding of biometric data and the potential for misuse.  
- The amendment comes two years after public consultation, with responses undisclosed.  
- The amendment broadens authentication services, previously limited mostly to banking and telecom industries.  
- In January, Aadhaar authentication transactions reached 129.93 billion, an increase from the previous year.  
- New applications for Aadhaar authentication will need approval from the Indian government based on UIDAI's recommendations.  
- Experts are calling for clearer guidelines to prevent misuse and ensure transparency in the application process.

items.title: OpenAI unveils a new ChatGPT agent for ‘deep research’
items.summary:
- OpenAI announced a new AI agent for in-depth research, named ChatGPT deep research.
- Designed for professionals in finance, science, policy, and engineering needing detailed and reliable research.
- Available for ChatGPT Pro users with a limit of 100 queries per month; wider rollout plans include Plus and Team users.
- Integration with mobile and desktop apps is expected later this month.
- Outputs will be text only initially, with future plans for images and data visualizations.
- ChatGPT deep research ensures documentation and citations for its outputs to enhance credibility.
- The new o3 model powering this feature has been trained for better reasoning and data analysis.
- Initial test results showed 26.6% accuracy on a challenging expert-level exam, outperforming its competitors.
